recipe.title: How to Make Ochazuke
recipe.intro: Ochazuke is a simple Japanese dish. You pour hot green tea or dashi over rice. It is warm and easy to make.
recipe.ingredients: rice, green tea or dashi stock, salmon (cooked), nori (seaweed), wasabi, sesame seeds, green onion, umeboshi (pickled plum)
steps: **Cook** the rice and put it in a bowl.
**Put** the cooked salmon on top of the rice.
**Add** small pieces of nori and green onion on top.
**Make** hot green tea or dashi stock.
**Pour** the hot tea slowly over the rice.
**Add** wasabi and sesame seeds on top. **Enjoy!**

review.content: I visited Parkside Tea Garden near South Bank last week. It was next to a beautiful park with big trees. I sat outside and the air was cool and fresh. I ordered ochazuke with salmon. The tea was hot and the salmon was very good. The restaurant was quiet and cozy. I saw jasmine flowers near my table. It was a very relaxing time.

australia_tips.title: オーストラリアでお茶漬けを作るなら
australia_tips.content:
お茶漬けは材料が少なくて簡単なので、ワーホリ中にぴったりの料理です。緑茶のティーバッグ（green tea bags）はスーパーのお茶コーナーで買えます。「Japanese green tea」を選ぶとよいでしょう。

スモークサーモン（smoked salmon）はオーストラリアのスーパーで簡単に手に入ります。日本の焼き鮭の代わりに使うとおいしいです。海苔やわさびはアジア食材店で買えます。

ブリスベンのサウスバンク（South Bank）は、街の中にある美しい公園エリアです。人工ビーチやレストラン、カフェがあり、週末にはマーケットも開かれます。ワーホリの人たちの憩いの場所です。

お茶漬けは体調が悪いときや疲れたときにも食べやすい料理です。オーストラリアでの生活に慣れるまで、簡単に作れるお茶漬けを覚えておくと安心ですよ。

conversation.scene: 風邪をひいたハウスメイトのLilyに、お茶漬けを作ってあげる場面

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Lily, are you OK? You look tired.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: I have a cold. I am not very hungry.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: I will make something light for you. Do you like rice?

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Yes, I like rice. What will you make?

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Ochazuke. It is rice with hot green tea. It is very easy to eat.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: That sounds nice. Is it warm?

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Yes, it is very warm. It is good when you are sick.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Thank you. You are so kind.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Here you are. I put salmon and seaweed on top.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Mmm, it smells good. Can I eat it now?

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Yes, please eat it slowly. It is hot.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: This is so good! I feel warmer now. Thank you!

quiz3.question: 会話の中で、Lilyはどうして元気がなかったですか？

try_it_hint: 「〇〇を作ってあげましょうか？」と提案する文を練習しましょう。例：I will make something warm for you. Do you like soup?
